text: Monken Hadley War Memorial The Monken Hadley War Memorial is located immediately to the north of Monken Hadley at the western end of Camlet Way in Monken Hadley Common. It commemorates the men of the district who died in the First and Second World Wars and is in the form of a tapered decorated column with a celtic cross at the top and the names of the dead shown on the shaft.Monken Hadley Common. London Gardens Online. Retrieved 4 September 2016. It was unveiled by Francis Fremantle, Member of Parliament for St. Albans, in December 1920. It became a Grade II listed building in April 2017. ==References== ==External links== * http://www.monkenhadleycommon.net/tour.html Category:World War I memorials in England Category:World War II memorials in England Category:Monken Hadley Category:Grade II listed monuments and memorials Category:Grade II listed buildings in the London Borough of Barnet Category:Military memorials in London
title: Monken Hadley War Memorial
